text: [Music]
Papa Panov special Christmas once upon a
time on the day of Christmas Eve in a
small village of Russia an old shoemaker
called Papa Panov stepped outside his
shop to take one last look around lights
had begun to appear in the shops and
houses and the short winter day
was nearly over excited children
scurried indoors and now only muffled
sounds of chatter and laughter escaped
from closed shutters the faint but
delicious smells of Christmas cooking
reminded him of past Christmas times
when his wife had still been alive and
his own children were little and with
him now they had gone away to the cities
his usually cheerful face looked sad now
with a heavy heart
he pulled the shutters and went inside
his house he set a pot of coffee to heat
on the charcoal stove and with a sigh
settled in his big armchair
[Applause]
Papa Panov did not often read but
tonight he pulled down the big old
family Bible
and slowly tracing the lines with one
forefinger he read again the Christmas
story Mary and Joseph walked
hand-in-hand and soon they were in
Bethlehem they were tired but found no
place to rest so Mary's little baby was
born in cowshed oh dear oh dear
if only they had come here I would have
given them my bed and covered the baby
with my quilt
instead and then came the three kings
looking for him carrying with them
splendid gifts little baby Jesus was
born in this world and together they
welcomes the King of Kings saddened Papa
Panov put down the Bible oh I have no
gift that I could give him suddenly his
face brightened I have just the right
thing yes they are as good as I remember
I should give them those saying that he
gently put them away and sat down again
he was feeling tired now and the further
he read the sleepier he became the print
began to dance before his eyes so that
he closed them just for a minute in no
time at all Papa Panov was fast asleep
you have been wishing that you could see
me POP
pan off tell you what look for me
tomorrow it will be Christmas Day and I
will visit you but look carefully for I
shall not tell you who I am
wait and with a startled Papa Panov
woke up from his sleep the bells were
ringing out and a thin light was
filtering through the curtains bless my
soul
this Christmas day he stood up and
stretched himself for he was rather
stiff when his sight went towards the
clock it was only 4:00 in the morning
what I am up so early
suddenly he heard a sound coming from
the outside and his face filled with
happiness as he remembered his dream my
dream yes my dream wow this would be a
very special Christmas after all
for Jesus is coming to visit me but but
how would he look would he be a little
baby
as that that first Christmas would he be
a grown man a carpenter or the great
king that he is I must watch carefully
the whole day so that I recognize him
however he came Papa Panov at once slid
open the curtains and opened the window
the street was deserted except for the
road speaker
it is the road sweeper but why is he
working on Christmas Day in this rock
called
theater freezing misty morning Hey
come in come in have some hot coffee to
keep out of the cold
the sweeper looked up scarcely able to
believe his ears he was only too glad to
put down his food and come into the warm
room he clasped both his red cold hands
around the comforting warm mug as he
drank expecting someone yes Papa Panov
told him all about his dream and how he
was waiting for Jesus to come well I I
hope he comes you've given me a bit of
Christmas cheer I never expected to have
I'd say you deserve to have your dream
come true
this made Papa Panov smile the road
sweeper finished his coffee and left
Papa Panov house filled with warmth and
happiness after some time Papa Panov
started to cook up some delicious hot
cabbage soup and would always keep going
to the window to look out for his
expectant visitor but as he looked out
he saw a young woman whose face was
almost as pale as the snow she was
holding a baby wrapped tightly in thin
blankets
my goodness how can someone be roaming
out there in the cold in the poor baby I
must call her in hey excuse me young
woman yeah but please please come into
my house and warm yourself the fire will
really help your baby too
the poor woman was in such disbelief
that tears welled in her eyes oh thank
you kind sir she let him lead her to his
warm fireplace as she sat there her
little baby started to gurgle oh how
adorable let me warm up some milk for
her oh and you don't have to worry I'll
feed her too is I've had young ones of
my own Papa Panov warmed and brought the
milk and carefully fed it to the baby
with a spoon but as he did he noticed
the baby's feet had turned a slight blue
because of the cold
she needs a shoes very badly too I don't
have the money for that and I'm on my
way to the next village to find a job
there isn't anything I can do
Papa Panov thought for a while and
remembered the little shoes he had seen
last night but those shoes for Jesus
but as he saw the little babies
frostbitten feet he at once made his
decision yeah you can have these oh look
how perfectly they theater well she
seems happy
the little baby girl kicked her legs
around and clean you have been so kind
to us may all your Christmas wishes come
true as the lady enjoyed the warm soup
he looked anxiously up and down the
street there were plenty of people about
but they were all faces that he
recognized there were neighbors going to
call on their families they nodded and
smiled and wished him Merry Christmas
when the soup was done with and the baby
was better
the woman thanked Papa Panov once again
and then left have a Merry Christmas
while at the door Papa Panov saw a
beggar walking in the freezing cold
he immediately hurried indoors to fetch
some hot soup and a generous hunk of
bread then he hurried out and gave it to
the beggar the beggar was delighted he
thanked him and left Papa Panov smiled
and went back indoors and soon the
winter dusk fell Papa Panov stood by his
window but could no longer make out the
passers-by 'he's most were home and
indoors dejected he walked back to his
armchair and sat back wearily so it was
just a dream after all suddenly there
appeared before him the old road sweeper
the young mother with her baby and the
beggar
didn't you see me Papa Panov what I I
don't understand
and then another voice answered him it
was the voice from his dream the voice
of Jesus I was hungry and you fed me I
was helpless and barefoot you fed me and
covered my feet with cozy shoes I was so
cold and tired I didn't know anyone
would notice me but you did and you gave
me such happiness I came as all three
and you noticed helped and loved us
equally Thank You Papa Panov could not
believe his eyes and his ears he was
overwhelmed with joy then all was quiet
and still only the sound of the big
clock ticking a great peace and
happiness seemed to fill the room
overflowing Papa Panov heart until he
wanted to burst out singing and laughing
and dancing with joy we wish you a Merry
Christmas we wish you a Merry Christmas
we wish you a Merry Christmas and
II
and thus Papa Panov generosity had made
his Christmas married after all no
matter who a person may be treating
anyone and everyone with all the
kindness you can offer is what really
makes the world a good one
no matter the religion God resides in
all the main thing we must do is love
everyone dearly and equally
